text: Pleasant surprise at a tap takeover. Solid flavor and only slightly too thin on the palate. Thankfully, more malty and generally nutty that forward peanuts. Good stuff unless you were hoping for peanuts.

Crowler, thanks to fatknitty! Pours deep black, large creamy tan head, aloe to dissipate, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, cocoa, peanut butter, ashtray. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter. PB Porter done right. Medium body. This beer has restored my faith in peanut butter beers in general.

32oz Crowler. Huge thanks to fatnitty who hooked it up a big time with this long time WL beer in the last local swap! Pours black with a finger of foamy beige head. Aroma is mostly peanuts and chocolate up front, with a hint of black coffee in the finish. Taste is much the same. Peanuts and earthy chocolate hit you first, followed by some day old coffee and hints of charred malts.

July 28, 2015. Tasting at jtclockworks, thanks for sharing!
Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is creamy peanut butter, chocolate, ground coffee,notes of milk chocolate and toffee. Taste is light to medium sweet, roasted peanuts and coffee, light bitterness. Finish is slightly thin with peanuts, coffee, toffee and chocolate. Light to mediumbodied, soft carbonation.

Sample, 1-ounce, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival, savoured on September 26 2015; eye: dark brown, semi-opaque, ring of brown head, light lacing; nose: roasting, nuts, light ashy, dark coffee; mouth: roasting, nuts, light ashy, dark coffee, finale in coffee with ashy presence, full body, good carbonation, lightly dusty texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, 1 once, en fût, durant le Great American Beer Festival, savourée le 26 septembre 2015; il : brun foncé, semi-opaque, anneau de mousse brune, légère dentelle; nez : torréfaction, noix, léger cendré, café noir; bouche : torréfaction, noix, léger cendré, café noir, finale en café avec présence cendrée, corsée, bonne carbonatation, texture légèrement poussiéreuse; en résumé : bien
Shared crowler at Jasons. Bg peanut coffee aroma. Medium body. Lots of flavor here.

Crowler shared with me from a friend. Poured brown with a medium foamy khaki head. Aroma of peanut butter, chocolate, and coffee. Flavor was more coffee up front for me with more mellow notes of peanut butter and chocolate. Very tasty. Medium body, slick texture, good carbonation, slightly bitter finish. Very solid brew.
Peanut butter in the smell, in the taste, coffee in the finish. Dark with lace dots. Smooth mouthfeel.

On tap at GTMW 2015, liquid peanut butter cup, yup. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head and a little bit of lacing, the aroma has a ton of peanut butter and chocolate with a good touch of sweetness, the flavor has the peanut butter punch you in the face with the chocolate in the finish, so good.
Smells like really nice roast and nuts. Tastes like smooth coffee, dark chocolate, and an aftertaste of peanuts. Medium body, medium sharp carbonation, and no foam.

Black pour with an orange hue, thin beige head and light lacing .... Aroma is of peanut butter, dark and semi sweet chocolate, roasted malts and fresh coffee ... Taste is of bitter dark chocolate, semi sweet chocolate, light peanut butter, lots of coffee notes and roasted malts... Has the body of a stout ... Finished dry and roasted with lingering coffee and chocolate .... Lived up to the hype for sure
Sampled at gabf. Smells like a oeanut butter cup dipped in coffee. Coffee leads the flavor. It is rich quality coffee. Peanuts. Very soft fruit. Citrus. Nice.

32 oz crowler shared by Spencer. The pour is a pretty good dark brown/ light black with a thin ring of khaki colored head and no lace. The aroma is great. There is a lot of peanut butter and chocolate to go along with the coffee. It's just what's advertised. Really good. There isn't little lactose on the back end, but for the most part it's like Reese's Puffs with coffee. Really good. The flavor is much of the same. There is a light lactose but the flavors are a little light. There is a peanut butter and some chocolate. The coffee takes on a little bit of an acidity here. The mouth feel is thin and light with a roasted coffee that lingers with a milky chocolate and peanut butter dust. Not bad, but it could be better

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark pour with tan head. Peanut butter, roasted and chocolate aromas. Chocolate and peanut butter, sweet malts.
Draft at the brewery. Creamy, roast coffee, peanut butter, vanilla, milk chocolate. Damn tasty.

On tap at Daily Growler, UA: black pour, tan head, sparse lacing. pleasant aroma of peanut butter, cocoa, coffee. tastes are roasted malts, coffee, chocolate with the peanut butter coming in late. medium palate and carbonation. does what it says in the title. drinkable. good stuff.

On draft at the brewpub with Patty and Dan. Later at night I shared a Crowler of it with Erica and Chris. Pours a dark brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of peanut butter, some roasted nuts, roasted malt but mostly coffee. Flavor also of Coffee to start with followed by peanut butter cup, sweet roasted malt, lactose and vanilla. As it warmed you taste lots more of the peanut butter cup. Great stuff!
Crowler thanks to Russell. Pours a clear brown with small beige head. The aroma is strong peanut butter and chocolate. Thin mouth, strong chocolateC light peanut butter, roast, sweet, very good.

Pour on tap, dark, hazy brownish black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of big peanut, sweet milk chocolate, lactose, some vanilla into nice espresso bean, coffee, some slight roast and hints of spice. Taste was remarkably like the description, some nice dark chocolate and milk chocolate, nice vanilla, touch of spice into nice peanut, sweet peanut butter, touch of roast into some big espresso beans, finishing mainly sweet, slightly roasted. Lived up to the hype for me.
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2015 Crowley from trustee. Pours black with tan head. Peanut butter is there, but not as strong as rap. Its a good porter, but not the pb bomb that if had with others.

Aroma: Clear nutty and coffee aromas. Appearance: Dark black with tan head.
Taste: Light bitterness with medium sweetness. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, dry sweet finish. Overall: Name is no lie--tastes like coffee and peanut butter. A bit too sweet for me, but still a solid beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured a dark brown, almost black color with a small sized head. Chocolate, peanut butter, coffee, and roast.

Wow. After reading glowing reviews about this I got 2 crowlers of this. The first I opened at a bottle share and unanimously it was detested. We all smelled the aroma of cat pee. This one I opened with some trepidation. Different story with this one. I immediatly noticed more of a coffee smell. As it opened up I got more of the peanut butter and the chocolate. Dark black color, with big 3 finger off white head. Taste is chocolate on the front and middle which melds into coffee and peanut butter on the back. Nicely balanced. Very nice offering.

This is the kind of beer that I wouldnt sleep with because that implies going home and doing it in bed. This is the sort of beer that I would take into the mens room and ride right there at the pub. Sampled on draft at the brewpub this beer poured a somewhat thick black color with a medium sized dark brown head that lingered and left great lacing. The aroma was strong peanut butter ice cream, coffee, vanilla, caramel and cocoa all wonderfully mixed. The flavor was strong cocoa, vanilla, cream, coffee and peanut. Not quite as flavorful as the nose promised but still excellent. The finish was very long. Fairly full bodied and smoothly creamy in mouthfeel (like I like it)!!! Incredible.

The best porter I have had so far! The smell is cocoa, coffee and peanut, the taste is bitter chocolate with a sweet peanut butter taste on the swallow. Only downside, not enough ABV, if you get a hold of this you will know why it needs more ABV, its too damn easy to drink its gone before you know it. More ABV would make this a sipper, this isnt a sipper this is a damn its gone already beer. Great!
Sample at GABF 2014. Comes almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, and malt. Taste is coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, and a touch of peanut butter. Very tasty.

Dark beer with a small beige ring for a head. Big coffee nose with hints of vanilla. Put me in the coffee camp with this beer. The initial flavor burst is rich black coffee. Chocolate and vanilla extract come soon after. There is some peanut butter hints in the finish. Nice creamy mouthfeel. This is a very nice coffee beer.

Draft at some goofball bar in Athens during Ohio Brew Week. Pours a deep brown color with a tan head. Everyone talks about the peanut butter in this, but I barely noticed any because there was so much coffee in it. Also chocolate, toast, and just a little bit of peanut butter. But only because I was looking for it and it had a slight salty dryness. Nutty finish. Medium-bodied, with medium carbonation and a roasty mouthfeel. Maybe it was this batch, but this is definitely more of a coffee porter than a peanut butter porter. Its still really good.
On tap. Black with good beige head. Coffee and slight peanut butter aroma. Taste is of coffee and chocolate. Excellent beer.

Growler shared by Matt...Thanks! Pours a very dark brown with minimal brown head. Small lacing in snifter. Powerful chocolate and peanut butter aroma. Man it smelled awesome. The taste was peanut and peanut butter forward, dark chocolate, some coffee, roasted malts and a hint of vanilla cream. Great thick body and slick on the tongue. Finish is peanuts and peanut butter.

Growler thanks to brigadier. Nose is a burnt reeses cup, with a noticeable peanut butter and coffee aroma. Very pleasant aroma. Taste is immediately peanur butter, chocolate, and then coffee and roastiness kicks in. All well balanced. Although I think the coffee detracts from the peanut butter and chocolate. Making me wonder if this is a peanut butter chocolate coffee they are using. I feel the roastiness is just a touch too much for the subtle and coy peanut butter flavor. The flavors are well expressed and dont come across as artificial as other peanut butter beers do. Also, very nice to see this at a low, sessionable 5.5% and not some 10+% impy stout. mouthfeel is a touch thin, but Ive experienced that with a lot of coffee beers. Maybe adding some lactose would make this mind blowing.

Dark brown, almost black color with small light brown head and nice rings of lacing. Aroma is faint but had nice cocoa notes. Flavor is excellent with strong cocoa malts, roasted coffee, and a little creamy sweetness. Very good overall

Got a growler of this thanks to beergodd1, thanks buddy. Pours dark brown with a thin white head. Nose is bitter bakers chocolate. Taste is slight peanut butter, vanilla with a stringent coffee finish. Nice beer

Syndicate provided this tonight at a bonafide epic tasting... Too many amazing beers. This was poured from a 64oz growler many times... Short lasting dark tan head... deep dark brown brew that allows a little light through... Nose is light cocoa and a bit more peanut essence... flavor is about as expected with dry cocoa and dry peanut, a bit more sweetness would go a long way to making this an upper echelon want. Very tasty, but needs to be dialed down. Thanks for the opportunity Darrel!!

Growler pours thanks to Darrel. Pours out a nice black topped with a small tan head. Nose is great roast malts sweet milk chocolate peanut butter and little trang. Taste is nice peanut butter cup is a great name the taste is on target.

Tap sample during Ohio Beer Week (also growlers) from notes. One of the solid brews from Ohio. Pours dark brown in color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malts, nice coffee notes, a mix of milk and dark chocolate with creamy peanut butter. Pretty much comes as advertised. This is one I would have over and over if it is available.

Tap, pours a dark black, aroma is coffee and a light pb in there. the taste is really quite like it sounds, its a creamy very smooth peanut butter and finishes with a roasty coffee, a very interesting offering. A fun beer that I will definitely keep my eye for.

Growler provided by James at 4k/5k/10k tasting. Pours black with a small head. Aroma is peanut butter, coffee, chocolate. Taste is mostly coffee with the peanut butter subdued. Bitter, roasted finish, medium body, soft carbonation.

Big thanks to Matt who sent this wonderful 64 oz growler, poured a black color with aromas of malt, choclate and peanutbutter. Flavors are all chocolate amd peanutbutter, this is amazing. A great beer that I sipped on all aftrrnoon, thanks again Matt.

Draft @ GABF 2013. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Has a roasted malty peanut butter and chocolate aroma. Roasted malty chocolate peanut butter flavor. Has a roasted malty peanut butter finish.

On tap poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lasting tan head. Aromas of roastiness, peanut butter, coffee, light dark chocolate and light vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of roastiness, coffee, peanut butter, dark chocolate and light caramel with a smooth lingering peanut butter finish.

A: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Thick Brown Head, Some Lacing

S: Coffee, Chocolate, Mild Dark Malts

T: Chocolate, Peanut Butter, Mild Coffee

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Coffee Bittrness

Overall, pretty true to the name and style, decent enough but some odd combinations.

Somethings wrong with this. The aroma comes across so rich and flavorful, almost as if youre actually smelling a fresh brewed cup of ground coffee. As the jet black ale hits your tongue, the coffee and a slight bit of peanut butter become apparent, but theyre quickly lost to an extremely disappointing sense of watery nothingness. This beer, in both appearance and aroma, promises richness - on that front it simply doesnt follow through. I have to say, it wasnt as sickly sweet as I had anticipated, but it went too far in the opposite direction - an inexcusable lack of complexity.

Multiple pours at GABF. Pour is deep brown/black with a small frothy brown head and great lacing. Huge peanut butter, graham crackers, marshmallows, a touch of roast, and cocoa in the aroma. Taste is tons of sweet peanut butter, chocolate, vanilla, lacto, a hint of coffee, toasted malt, and nutty. Light body with soft carbonation. Really fun beer and would be even better with a little more body.

On tap @ GABF. Black pour with a large khaki head. Really good peanut aroma. Roasted malt, chocolate, graham cracker, and a touch of coffee. Flavor of chocolate covered peanut butter. Roasted malt, coffee, and dark chocolate. A bit of sweet malt, too. Quite nice.
Sampled at GABF 2013. Brown/black with a tan head. Smells just like a peanut butter cup. Flavor is light roast, chocolate, peanut butter, light coffee.

Black pour with a thin head. Aroma is full of peanut butter, chocolate and coffee. Medium mouth. Sweet taste full of coffee and hints of peanut butter. Big time carbonation. A very interesting beer that I really enjoyed.
On tap at World Beer Festival in Cleveland. Loved this! I absolutely love peanut butter and chocolate so this beer has it all.

Growler from the brewery, dark brown pour with some red hues, tan head with spotty lacing. Strong aroma of peanut butter, coffee, malt and chocolate. Taste is a lot of coffee up front with some sticky chocolate and some nice peanut butter and roasted malt, solid!

On tap at Pigskin during OBW, poured into a OBW sample glass. Pours dark brown with small off-white head. Medium body, low carbonation, and coffee aroma. Taste is lots of roasty coffee and some peanut butter. I was expecting more, but still pretty good. This had lots of cheap coffee taste to me.

Sampled at Clockworks 4K/5K/10K gathering 2013. Growler courtesy of Clockwork, I believe. Pours a deep brown body with no head or lacing. Aroma is roast, nuts and chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium and lightly roasted with notes of chocolate-covered peanuts, coffee and a light sweetness. Very nice porter.

Black, tan head. Nose is peanut butter, roasted coffee. Coffee aroma takes a turn from rich gourmet to cheap k-cup as the beer warms, but the nose is still nice. Taste is peanut butter cup, a touch of breadiness that gives it a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie touch. Some coffee in the taste but not like the nose. Medium bodied, a bit watery.

Peanut butter and coffee blend surprisingly well. I cant quite tell where one ends and the other begins. Chocolate is there as well. Kind of like a gourmet Reeses Peanut Butter Cup. Only flaw is that the peanut butter flavor lingers a little too long. Rich beer.

4 oz sample from the brewery.  This is the reason I came here, wanted to try this for a while.  Pours opaque black with a small frothy head that fades and collects at the edges.  Aroma leaps at you, perfect balance of coffee beans and peanut butter.  The taste has more of a dry roasted peanut taste mixed with bitter light roasted coffee.  Very light sweetness and moderate bitterness.  Thin mouthfeel, a little watery.  Overall, this is really good but Im a little disappointed.  Could definitely use a bigger body and more sweetness.  I also didnt taste any chocolate.  But its hard to beat that delicious aroma.

Rating #2000. Growler from John with a bunch of heady brahs in VT. Notes of Iced coffee, peanut butter big cups, milk chocolate, and perfectly roasted malts and coffee. Everything was balanced with the right amount of peanut butter and dark roasty malt. Body was medium to full but never filling or overly heavy. Crazy smooth and drinkable at 5.5%. This is maybe the best peanut butter beer I have tried. Thanks for sharing.
Growler, lighter bodied black pour. Peanut butter is very evident in aroma. Roasted coffee, chocolate notes. Pretty unique flavor. Cool beer
Growler. Black with tan head. Nose and taste of creamed peanuts with shells, roast chocolate malt and light coffee roast. Body is a little lighter than expected.

Growler at Jamess 4k/5k/10k tasting.  Pours a deep brown to black with a thin white head.  Smells amazing, big fatty peanuts (and not rancid like a lot of peanut beers seem to get), and a nice coffee backbone.  Flavor keeps this going, lots of peanut butter and then chocolate covered espresso beans.  Lingering coffee and peanuts.  Very well done.  Lovely stuff.

Pours a dark brown light black no head. Aroma of lots of coffee.  Peanut butter on the taste, chocolate and coffee. Not bad but a bit too thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Pours black with frothy tan head. Finally get to try this. Aroma is all peanut butter cup. Taste is medium body with lots of coffee and peanut butter. With a little more sugar this would be 4.5-5
It is a straight up, not-sweet, liquid coffee flavored peanut butter cup.  Wild stuff, pretty intensely flavored yet still sessionable.
My first peanut beer. Had at GABF. Bordering on being a bit weird but still very pleasant. Nice roasted flavor complementing the peanut butter notes. Very much like a reeces cup beer.

Tried this beer on tap at the GABF in Denver, CO. Great porter with aromas of peanut butter and roasted nuts. Flavor is standout peanut butter with chocolate notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at GABF on Saturday October 13, first sessionBlack color, tan head. Coffee, roasted scent. Coffee, sweet, roasted taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Coffee aftertaste, also hazelnuts.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a dark brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of pure peanut butter, some roasted nuts, and roasted malt. Flavor also of peanut butter cup but more sweet roasted malt, lactose, and vanilla are present. Lots of peanut butter in this beer, less coffee. Very tasty and it does live up to its name!
8/4/8/4/15 (3.9/5)
The taste was exceptional, coffee hitting first and finishing with peanutbuttery goodness. The dark roasted malts played well over the infused flavors.

Excellent porter.  Mild coffee and medium peanut butter cup flavors.             

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(draft @ 101 Bottles - Kent, OH) Pitch black pour with a thin tan head. Heavy coffee and chocolate aroma with some nice and rich peanut and peanut oil notes under it. Flavor is amazingly smooth. Coffee that moves to chocolate with the best peanut butter flavor Ive had in a beer. Rich and creamy and the flavors blend well together and leave a sweet and chocolatey aftertaste.

Growler shared at Muckfest III - Pours black with a bubbly tan head. Nose is peanut brittle, chocolate, a little roast--the peanut smells a little artificial. Taste is more straight up, with hazelnut, medium roast, and some coffee finally showing. Real thin in the mouth, with lots of carbonation. Per usual with combos like this, it sounded way better than it tasted.

Growler shared at MuckFest 3 - Friday Edition. Thanks! Pours a richly blackish pour, dark with brownish ruby edges. Firm haze and frothy tannish head atop, good layer that turns into a thicker film. Solid lacing. Aromas are richly cocoa and peanut butter. Peanutbutter cup, chocolate, toffee. Caramel, toasty malts and gentle roast. Some coffee. Sweet Peanutbutter cup nose takes over, a bit creamy and inviting. Initial is medium bodied, perhaps a bit bigger with ruch cocoa, dark chocolate, vanilla, and fudge. Peanut butter, peanuts, and toast. Middle leads way to a touch of thickness, some toffee, caramel, and inviting sweet sticky malts. Cocoa, thicker sweetness moves into a roasty and gentle coffee element into the backend. Inviting, pretty well done. Sufficient thickness without being too thin or overbearing.

Sampled at Ohio Brew Week 2012 (in a plastic cup). Dark color, little tan head. Wow, distinctly peanut butter nose, really amazing. Nice, rich and savory, smooth lighter carbonation, long peanut butter aftertaste. Little bit of lace. This is the first peanut butter beer Ive ever had, and its definitely piqued my interest. Light sweet taste, in the way that a peanut butter chocolate milk shake would be. Chocolate aromas. Awesome, and very memorable.

Growler thanks to Joe! Pours near black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a combination of sweet chocolate and peanut butter with a bit of backing sweet dark grains. Flavor has more roast with a combination of bitter and sweet chocolate and a note of peanut butter in the finish.

growler from dakine 11/25/11.

darker than the typical porter with a soft tan head.

theres definitely something salty in the aroma.... along with mild pb, tons of coffee, roast, ash, chocolate and lactose.

the flavor is heavy on the roast and ash... followed by an enormous amount of coffee, oily peanut butter, salt and choco.

it maintains crispness and is nicely carbonated. very cool stuff. 8/4/8/4/17

Draught at Brewpub.  Dark black pour with wonderful nose of fresh roasted coffee, peanut butter and hints of chocolate. Nice lacy head and the first sip follows through on what the aroma offered.  Nice blend of coffee and nutty flavors with roasted and chocolate malts.  This is not a gimmick beer, rather a well-made craft beer.

Courtesy of daknole. Growler at the Black Friday Tasting pours a nice mahogany with ruby red edges and tan head. The aroma offers up caramel, rich dark roasted coffee, a bit of toffee infused peanut butter and nearly burnt malts. Great aroma. The taste is similar with dark roasted malts to modestly burnt malts, highly roasted coffee beans and some smooth peanut butter. Yummy.

On tap at the Brewery, The name of this "Almost" scared me away. But the name also "intrigued" me. I was pleasantly surprised. Poured Black, with a small foamy head. Aroma was Pure Chocolate and Dark Coffee Beans. Taste was the same, a blast of Dark coffee, Chocolate, roasted malt....very smooth, and not too sweet. I didnt taste peanut butter till the finish, which I think was a perfect place to be. Nice job. Wish I brought my growler.

On tap at rozis pour is a black oily substance which aroma erupts coffee and a slight hint of peanut butter, as I smell closer I get more peanut butter the first sip is a wonderful blend of roasty peanut butter with a balance of coffee and malt, this is good stuff, liquid crack as some have said

(Growler at Black Friday tasting.  I think Dak brought this).  Pours a dark brown color with red hue and thin off-white head that rings the glass.  Aroma is coffee, peanut butter and chocolate.  Wow!  Taste is sweet with an awesome peanut butter flavor.  Medium bodied with a slick texture.  Really successful beer.  We had a heavy hitter list of beers for the tasting and this one was one of the best by most accounts.

Growler at Black Friday, thanks to miketd for sending this.  Deep brown pour, brown head.  Damn what an awesome beer.  I was suspicious of this beer...but I was wrong! Tons of coffee and creamy peanut butter aroma with roasted malt and chocolate.  Flavor is heavy on the coffee up front, but as this beer warms it takes on a creamy body and the peanut butter shows itself well.  Loved it.

Sampled from a growler brought to the Black Friday tasting.  Dark mahogany pour with crimson edges and nice latte head.  Aroma is divine.  Lots of Nestle Quik, Hersheys syrup, and Skippy peanut butter along with roasted coffee, vanilla, and caramel.  Almost like a double dipped Reeses PB cup...more chocolate than nuttiness although it is present.  Ample carbonation...a little thin but still thick enough to stick.  Really great start to a great night!
Poured from a growler. If you are looking for a beer to get a women into craft beer this is it! So tasty
Growler at Black Friday Tasting. Dark chocolate reeses cup. Not as sweet as Kuhnenns version. Coffee, roast, and chocolate in the finish. Pretty awesome beer.

Growler fill thanks to miketd... Pours a darker, mostly opaque, cola stout pour with reddish brown edges and topped with a fluffy light beige head tha eventually reduces to a thin film... Aroma is creme brûlée-esque that has a large coffee vanilla expression with much less of a peanut butter presence but still a nice semi-sweet desert like feel to it. Some nuttiness surfaces but never quite develops to a full fledged peanut butter nature...flavor continues on a very similar wavelength with creme brûlée toffee vanilla notes with a nutty aspect to it that meshes quite well. Medium bodie xwith a medium level of carbonation. Tasty for sure and was pleasantly surprised. Kind of impressed.

Dark brown, could be murky, huge tan head, light lacing... roast coffee chocolate peanut butter cup... wow, this is shockingly good, roasty chocolaty with just a subtle note of peanut butter that beccomes bolder in the finish... medium to almost medium thin body, dryer finish, roast coffee finish... not sweet, which is awesome, really makes me applaude the brewer...

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2013 Growler sent from a cool dude...fatknitty...been dieing to try this!  pours deep brown/black with a medium mocha head...nice lacing.  Awesome aroma has notable peanut butter...not overbearing...with nice roasty coffee.  Flavor is roasty and slightly hoppy with subtle coffee...the peanut butter and a hint of chocolate sneaks up at the end and lingers with some roastiness in the finish.  Mouthfeel is medium.  Great job with this...couldnt have combined these flavors better!

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 The was a wonderfully inventive beer a decade ago. It has not held up so well+++ Sampled on draft at the brewpub this beer poured a somewhat thick black color with a medium sized dark brown head that lingered and left great lacing. The aroma was strong peanut butter, coffee, vanilla, caramel and cocoa. The flavor was strong cocoa, vanilla, cream, coffee and peanut but was rather dry. The finish was very long. Fairly full bodied and smoothly creamy in mouthfeel. Solid.

pours black with a full creamy tan head with thick sheets of lace clinging to the sides of the galss.  Smells of roast coffee, a slight peanut butter, chocolate, and a touch of brown sugar.  Thin on the palate with strong notes of bitter coffee, slight peanut butter, chocolate.  The finish is really bitter from the roast.

Growler from Veldrid just because hes a frigging great guy.  Hope the wedding was awesome.  Pour is black with a great, strong tan/brown head.  Two fingers of head after two weeks in the growler.  Not bad, eh?  Nose is massively cocoa/chocolate and coffee.  No doubt about the cocoa/coffee connection here.  Smells like a cold mocha coffee drink from the cafe.  Taste is cold coffee and lots of chocolate and cocoa.  Bitter and sweet, and creamy too.  The only disappointment for me is the lack of obvious peanut butter.  I desperately want to try a porter/stout that has the actual saltiness of peanut/butter.  Finish is light like a porter, not rich and gooey like a stout.  Love this brew.  Thanks a ton Veldrid for sending me this gem.  I wish more people would randomly send me free growlers of world-class brew, just for answering a question on a thread.  This is why I love Ratebeer.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 Poured from draft. Appearance is a dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma is of sweet coffee and a touch of creamy peanut butter. Taste is peanut butter and chocolate fading to an Oreo with a dollop of peanut butter on top. Smooth and full bodied porter. This beer kicks ass!

This is a great porter. Very nice chocolate and coffee notes on the nose. The surprise for me was that I received this as 1 of 2 growlers and they were mismarked. Nice notes of peanut butter, chocolate and coffee. Perfectly carbonated with a nice mouthfeel. This beer was a wonderful surprise! Thanks Brigadier.

Gorwler shared with BigMmartin.  Aroma is strong with roasted coffee and burnt malts.  Notes of chocolate, peanut butter, vanilla, and expresso stand out.  Palate is smooth.  Flavor really brings out a peanut butter cup type taste.  Different, but pretty damn good,  Thanks Mike.

Thanks to jale for sharing this. Served in a Hill Farmstead wine glass at our Anniversary Party pre-event.

Pours a very dark brown color with a good tan head that persisted for a bit. Slight lacing as it went down into a thin cap. The nose is just as it was described -- a good amount of chocolate with peanut butter backing. Really interesting. Some mild malt presence in the background bringing some roast forward. The flavor doesnt hit as hard on the peanut butter, though it is there. Flavor is mostly chocolate and roast. Dark chocolate. Medium body and good carbonation. Solid brew, Id be glad to have it again.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 06-04-2011

Growler from my in-laws.  The first thing I noticed was the peanut butter that had settled on the bottom of the growler after it sat for a day or so.  The aroma and flavor are pretty spot on.  Its pretty much a melted down Reeses peanut butter cup with a hit of coffee.  I think the peanut butter actually stands out the most to me.  The one downfall is the thin body.   Overall though, an incredibly smooth, unique brew that Im really glad I got to try.

Growler sample. Poured black color with an minimal brown head that diminished slowly with fair lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted coffee and roasted peanuts aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium dark sweet flavor with medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid complex beer that would go well with a good after dinner cigar.

On draught at the brewpub. The beer is an opaque dark brown color with a medium tan head that diminishes steadily. Thin rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of chocolate malt, peanut butter and a bit of coffee. Rich and smooth body with a nice peanut butter mocha flavor that is sweet but not cloying. Mild coffee bitterness underneath throughout. The finish is malty with a roasty, peanut butter finish that lingers. Good beer all around.

Really fun porter. The name both intrigued and repelled me. However, at 5.5 this is almost a sessonable porter and it works wonderfully.  Nose was full of peanut butter and rich freshly brewed coffee. First sip was as if having a peanut butter cup with an expresso... full flavored and well balanced porter. I cant wait to get more for the winter when Id really appreciate it!

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2011 Draught sample at the Cleveland International Beer Fest on 5/14/11. One of the standouts of the fest for sure. Opaque darkest brown pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of peanut butter, coffee and chocolate. Peanut butter flavor with coffee and a chocolate finish. Great ingredients, but all very volatile. Really easy to screw it up and end up with one dominating flavor. These are all balanced beautifully and make for a delicious complex beer.

This was probably the most unique of all the beers tasted.  The aroma of peanut butter and the mixed taste of coffee.  The porter poured a deep black.  There was Cocoa Cola also in the flavors.   The smooth finish had you wanting more.  I was surprised at how well these ingredints blended together

This poured a darker brown with a lighter tan head. Aroma was strainght peanut butter cups, mainly peanut butter with light dark chocolate too, lots of coffe too. Flavor was more coffee than the nose, but the peanut butter and chocolate are still there for sure. I know its a bit gimmicky, but this is some great stuff.

pitch black with tan head.  moderate high carbonation for style.  roasty nose, maybe a touch of pb.  little hop bitterness.  a ton of coffee flavor and bitterness that lingers well and is enjoyable, however it ends up being too acrid with little crystal balance and i just dont taste the peanut butter.  a coffee stout that could be good if the malt was there because the coffee flavor is

"Something unique for sure, peanut butter aroma and flavor is easily noticed. Pours a dark brown with a dark tan head and ample lacing. Smells of peanuts, chocolate and coffee. Medium bodied and very soft to the palate. Nutty, roasty, lightly sweet with a trace of bitter hops. Great angle for a porter."

7/13/2009:  Finally!  I have missed this beer the last two years because they ran out early, but not this time...  Willoughby Peanut Butter Cup Coffee Porter is dark cola brown/almost black in color with a small tan-colored head.  It has lots of coffee and cream in both the aroma and flavor.  There is a little bit of a Reeses Pieces quality as well as some other roasty notes in the flavor, but thats about it.  This beers medium body is a touch thin, but makes it easy to put down several pints in quick succession.  I am disappointed with this beer.  I was really hoping for the peanut butter to be there, but it really just isnt - at all.  More or less this is a just a coffee porter that is somewhat one-dimenstional with a great name that almost makes your mouth water.  Oh well, maybe Southern Tier or Stone or somebody like that will actually do a real PEANUT BUTTER beer one of these years!
Several pints (draught) at Pigskin Bar & Grill in Athens, Ohio during Ohio Brew Week 2009.  Rating #2 for this beer.

On tap at brewpub
This was the current release from the small batch offerings that caught my eye.  As soon as I saw the name I knew it was worth trying no matter how strange it may taste.  After all once you have had the Chocolate Donut beer or Southern Tiers Choklat how can you not seek out some billing itself as peanut buttery?  Unfortunately it didnt quite live up to expectations though it was a solid release.
Aroma / Appearance - The fluid black body looked like your typical porter.  The nose was of strong black coffee blended with milk and creamer.  A hint of chocolate was evident but just barely.  If you like coffee porters and stouts this would be right up your alley.
Flavor / Palate - Day old watery black coffee filled my mouth after the first sample.  A trace of peanut butter swirled down my throat but it was short lived.  The dominant characteristic here is the coffee; this may be a spinoff of the PDG Porter that is perpetually on tap.  In the end it was a little too one-dimensional for my liking.  You may see things differently.
